data.title: Remove building auto-targeting from Defend stance
data.body:
In all the original games units did not automatically target structures.  The later games that featured stances added this as part of the "Aggressive / Attack Anything" stance that we partially implemented and then left dangling.  @Mailaender gave this a shot in #3337, but had to back it out in #3467 because our AI logic wasn't smart enough to deal with it.

This feature fell off the radar after that, except for the occasional complaint from players about how awkward it is to use engineers / spies / etc with groups of combat units shooting the things they want to capture/infiltrate/etc.

We now have all the technical pieces in place to do this properly, and it nicely rounds off the targeting and stance changes we are aiming for in the next release.

If players *do* want units to auto-target buildings then they can use the new command bar to easily change stance.  Base defenses are still auto-targeted from both Defend and Attack Anything.

data.title: GCOnDeploy's ValidTerrain() takes location parameter
data.body:
Fixes #13394.

Possible use: AI's future deploy planning when the actor isn't actually
there yet. Also used in my mod for Slave Miner's deploy planning

data.title: Add deploy activities for mods and future AI scripting
data.body:
Created deploy activities for mods and AI scripting or for use as ChildActivity. I had no desyncs when I tested these with my Slave Miners and TS mod.

Fixes #13400 naturally by making deploy activities.

data.title: Fix PlatformTests
data.body:
Fixed the failing tests in PlatformTest.

The AppDomain.CurrentDomain.BaseDirectory property was a bit of a gotcha because I got a trailing backslash from it when debugging the game, but not in the test.

Perhaps the BUG-comment is redundant, if it is missing the separator we just add it in the property.

data.title: Conditional (External)Capturable
data.body:
Capturable and External capturable are now conditional. Potentially, Building.Lock() can be replaced by this modification, not applied in this PR at the moment.

Needed for "mind control" system in RA2. Suppose there is a building-mind-controller of player A.  It will capture the structure of player B. Then the third player C decides to capture it with an engineer.  The building will be C's, for now. But if the mind controller dies, at the time of mind control, it was A's so the building will be returned to A's. (Can't hard code this situation to transfer ownership on mind control because in Kane's Wrath, a mind controller can snatch what someone has already controlled so capturing isn't the only way of ownership change for units that are already mind controlled)

To prevent that, OnOwnerChange notifier must be modified to deliver extra information on what activity changed the ownership so that eventually A's mind controller knows who the building should be returned to.

Another way is to forbid the capture of mind controlled buildings by making Capturable traits conditional.

data.title: Fix upgrade rule dates and iso rescaling upgrade rule
data.body:
- Several upgrade rules were merged after prep split off, but had a date older than last release.
- The isometric rescaling upgrade rule lacked a check for isometry (so it would run on RA etc. too), and it was missing upgrades for various Health.Shape values, which would be a pain for external mods that already set up shapes.

data.body:
On theory, infantries share cells with friendly units but in practice, they block someone's way who is doing MoveWithinRange

https://youtu.be/MyU3n966C2Y

* If I remove Tanya and retry attack dog leaps as expected
* If I move Tanya when it is stuck in MoveWithinRange state, the unit stays still, stuck in MoveWithinRange

Fixed 3 places with missing FrozenActor.Actor==null check - EnterTunnelOrderTargeter, CarryallPickupOrderTargeter, RevealOnFire.

data.title: Refactor WithVoxelWalkerBody to support more fine-grained TickRate

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body: The only actor in our official mods that needs this trait is the Mammoth Mk. II, and it would look best with a TickRate of roughly "1.5". The currently used `1` plays the anim too fast, `2` would be too slow.

data.title: Add a project code of conduct.
data.body:
See https://github.com/blog/2380-new-community-tools and https://opensource.guide/code-of-conduct/.

The Contributor Covenant looks reasonable to me, although IMO version 1.3 (used by mono, the .NET foundation, and others) reads as being more genuine than the 1.4 version offered as a default template.

data.title: Allow queueing of BridgeRepair
data.body:
This PR removes CancelActivity() in RepairsBridge trait so that engineers can be queued to take a safer detour path if necessary.

There's a catch though. The last move order just before RepairBridge seems to be ignored for some reason. You have to queue many move orders to see this patch in effect. I think it is a bug coming from Enter.cs + Move.cs which I think is beyond the scope. Hopefully, after activities are refactored, the problem will be gone.

Fixes #13471

data.title: RA1 cameo text plugin for GIMP
data.body:
I made a GIMP plugin to automate letter embedding for RA1 cameos.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IHOe-uCPbh8

One of the common-case use for OS SHP Builder would be making cameos. Unfortunately

* It doesn't run without Wine, on Linux.
* RA1 cameo is bugged to use RA2 font

Parameters can be adjusted to support other fonts too by defining widths of each letter and the path where the PNG files of the letters are. I think it can become part of OpenRA tools? (such as tile builder?)

data.title: Can't have multiple RejectsOrders
data.body:
When slaves are freed from slave miners they should do almost everything except harvesting. Before that, no order should be taken from the player. However, having multiple traits crash the game.

	RejectsOrders:
		RequiresCondition: !freed
	RejectsOrders:
		RequiresCondition: freed
		Except: Attack, AttackMove, Guard, Move, Follow, Enter

data.title: INotifyOwnerChanged interface doesn't deliver enough information
data.body:
It needs to have "what action changed the ownership" field, preferably in string type.

Scenario: Let's say there is building mind controller, like Yuri Prime. His MC is temporary so that when the mind control effect goes away due to Yuri's death or Yuri controlling something else, the building's ownership should be reverted back to creator owner.

However, MC isn't the only method of ownership change. There is already a permanent MC, in the name of "Engineer capture". For engi capture, creatorOwner must change so that if the captured actor gets mind controlled, it should be returned to the new capturer = the new creatorOwner.

In Kane's Wrath, cultists can mind control enemy units. In Traveller mirror, they often fight over a few high tier units. Even the creator owner can mind control what enemy has mind controlled! (In this case, the owner gets the unit 100% back, the unit is not counted as mind controlled anymore.)

Then there's slave miner. Killing the slave driver changes the creatorOwner of the slaves, in case they get mind controlled.

Maybe RA2 Garrison needs this too?

data.title: Clear previous effects data when generating a new sync report
data.body:
Fixes #13499.

Since we reuse the `Report` object, if we don't clear the list, we just keep adding new effects to the list until it explodes. Whoops!

data.body:
In some mods, there are so many effects that

In SyncReport.cs, GenerateSyncReport(), 

					report.Effects.Add(new EffectReport()

The report accumulates and eventually crashes the game. At the start of the game the games takes up about 400MB then explodes to 1.2GB then dies. Can it be turned off?

data.title: Rush AI produces too many airfields
data.body: Rush AI created 19 air fields but no airplanes in skirmish game. Debug mode was on and "Instant Build Speed" was selected.

data.title: Allow actors to target CenterPosition
data.body:
For very inaccurate weapons with high range, it makes more sense to shoot at the center of targets regardless of any closer targetable positions.

Applied to artillery actors in RA, TD and TS (see respective commits).

Note that this *does* decrease their effective firing range vs. larger buildings, so it's basically a trade-off of more average damage for less average range vs buildings larger than a single cell.

Closes #13496.

data.title: Add support for targeting CenterPosition
data.body:
As mentioned in #13448, there are some cases - inaccurate artillery weapons, mostly - where targeting the center of actors makes more sense than targeting the closest targetable position.

In D2k we should leave things as they are to stay true to the original, but a few units in the other mods would work better with this:
RA - Artillery, Cruiser, Missile Sub
TD - Artillery, MLRS, Grenadier???
TS - Juggernaut

data.title: Make the Enter activity use the closest target position.
data.body:
Closes #8064.
Closes #11416.

data.title: WithInfantryBody now supports playing "make" animation
data.body:
Much needed animated infantries with RA2 in mind. (and currently affects D2K thumper)

Since WithSpriteBody and WithInfantryBody have quite a different animation management, it seems suitable to introduce an IPlayCustomAnimation interface for those that provide custom animation logics. Sounds sensible, it has potential to support animated voxel deployer.

To test this, run D2K mod then deploy a thumper. Unfortunately, thumper deploy animation (make sequence in thumper entry) is only 5 frames long and is too short to see. Extend its length for testing purpose if needed. Currently, thumper can move while the lengthy deploy/undeploy animation is playing. That is probably due to GrantConditionOnDeploy not taking away mobility while the animation is playing. (or is it the YAML not using Undeployed for the mobile condition?)

Demo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o4jyIDtD72s

Fixes #12632

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
When the map editor is initializing actor panel previews, specifically for `jugg`, an odd `IdealPreviewSize` is being set and preventing it + further actors in the loop from being selectable.


In [ActorPreviewWidget](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/ActorPreviewWidget.cs#L69), `r` yielded 3 renderables -- the third is a `FinalizedVoxelRenderable`, and its `ScreenBounds()`  is returning an off width/height.
